intro: Cyanea communis, commonly known as the common bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has slender, branching stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Cyanea communis thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats.
